item.title: The Dzana
item.summary: The dzana taps on dry trees. It frightens away other animals who think its tapping is made by people.
item.comments: 1) This story was told to Tamme by his paternal grandfather (?) and he observed it himself, 2) Date on p.9885: 9 & 12 July, 3) p.9884v: (13 July 1881) a note on a caterpillar seen at Mowbray on this date, 4) This story is found in Book XI & XII-11
item.author: Tamme (XII)

keyword.subkw: taps on a dry tree, or |ßkao
used by the !kun for an animal or bird
